abstract: The company said Richard C. Breeden would leave at the end of the tax season, on April 18, to devote more time to his hedge fund.
snippet: The company said Richard C. Breeden would leave at the end of the tax season, on April 18, to devote more time to his hedge fund.
lead_paragraph: H&R Block, the tax preparation company, said Richard C. Breeden would step down as chairman, more than three years after he took control of the company in a proxy fight. Mr. Breeden, 61, plans to leave on April 18, the company said Thursday in a statement. He intends to devote more time to his hedge fund, Breeden Capital Management, H&R Block said. The company did not name a successor. Mr. Breeden, a former head of the Securities and Exchange Commission, was elected chairman Sept. 6, 2007.

headline.main: Chairman to Step Down at H&R Block
headline.print_headline: Chairman to Step Down at H&R Block
